description:
Justice, and the enforcement of it, has changed. In the 22nd century, Japan enforces the Sibyl System, an objective means of determining the threat level of each citizen by examining their mental state for signs of criminal intent, known as their Psycho-Pass. Inspectors uphold the law by subjugating, often with lethal force, anyone harboring the slightest ill-will; alongside them are Enforcers, jaded Inspectors that have become latent criminals, granted relative freedom in exchange for carrying out the Inspectors' dirty work.

Into this world steps Akane Tsunemori, a young woman with an honest desire to uphold justice. However, as she works alongside veteran Enforcer Shinya Kougami, she soon learns that the Sibyl System's judgments are not as perfect as her fellow Inspectors assume. With everything she has known turned on its head, Akane wrestles with the question of what justice truly is, and whether it can be upheld through the use of a system that may already be corrupt.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

Note: In the Summer 2014 season, Psycho-Pass was rebroadcast and re-edited to fit into an hour time-slot, ending up in 11 one-hour episodes. This edit included added scenes at the beginning and middle of the episodes, as well as fixing and improving animation.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

node.description:
__Debut__: 1998

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/amano_akira_)

Akira Amano is the author and mangaka of the shonen manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! They were born in 1973, but the month and day are unknown.  Amano began in 1998 with a job at Weekly Young Magazine. They also held a job at Shueisha Publishing Co, Ltd.  In 2002, Amano participated in a contest for aspiring mangaka and was one of the lucky winners, with their comic Monkey Business published in Young Magazine.  In 2004, they finally found success with the humorous and classy manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (or, for short, just Reborn!), and that thanks to their readers' support. This new manga was advertised more and more in Shonen Jump and became a hit. Two years later, their manga was made into an anime series by Artland studios. 

Their ideas for Reborn!: Amano had some crazy ideas to entertain readers with. They came up with weird characters to add spice to the humor, a story written especially to be unique, and fast-paced action.    

Other works:  Boy Spin (1998)  Hot Blast Baseball Legendary (1999)  Pu Chipu Chirabii (2000)  Monkey Business (2002)  Tapir Hearts HAWK! (2003)  Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (2004)    Colleagues:  Ken Osamu Sakaki  KAITO  Main pine of indigo  Kobayashi  Kasuga truth
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/81232543) | [Blog](http://fmkkoe.blog27.fc2.com/)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)

node.description:
[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_van_Beethoven)

Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer and pianist.

Beethoven remains one of the most admired composers in the history of Western music; his works rank amongst the most performed of the classical music repertoire. His works span the transition from the classical period to the romantic era in classical music. His career has conventionally been divided into early, middle, and late periods. The "early" period, during which he forged his craft, is typically considered to have lasted until 1802. From 1802 to around 1812, his "middle" period showed an individual development from the "classical" styles of Joseph Haydn and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, and is sometimes characterized as "heroic." During this time, he began to suffer increasingly from deafness. In his "late" period from 1812 to his death in 1827, he extended his innovations in musical form and expression.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

Gen Urobuchi is a Japanese novelist and screenwriter. He is a key member of the video game and visual novel developer [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/studio/459/Nitroplus) and currently serves as the company's representative director and vice-president.

He is best known as the co-creator of the highly acclaimed and commercially successful anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magica/), which earned him the Tokyo Anime Award for Best Scriptwriter. His other major works include the acclaimed Nitroplus-developed visual novel, *Saya no Uta*, the anime series [PSYCHO-PASS](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/PSYCHOPASS/), the light novel and anime series [Fate/Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/10087/FateZero/), and the tokusatsu TV show *Kamen Rider Gaim*. Urobuchi is one of the most renowned and prolific writers in the anime industry.

Anime series written by Urobuchi that have won the Newtype Anime Award have been Puella Magi Madoka Magica in 2011, Fate/Zero in 2012 and [Psycho-Pass: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/20514/PSYCHOPASS-The-Movie/) in 2015.

A film buff, Urobuchi likes to include film homages in his works. He has named Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Sergio Leone, and John Carpenter to be his favorite directors. As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~
[Website](http://www.yugokanno.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yugokanno)

ryo is the leader of [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell). He is the composer, arranger, and lyricist for all their songs.  In 2011 he created the fictional band [EGOIST](https://anilist.co/staff/114169) for the TV anime [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793).

ryo is the leader of [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell). He is the composer, arranger, and lyricist for all their songs.  In 2011 he created the fictional band [EGOIST](https://anilist.co/staff/114169) for the TV anime [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793).

ryo is the leader of [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell). He is the composer, arranger, and lyricist for all their songs.  In 2011 he created the fictional band [EGOIST](https://anilist.co/staff/114169) for the TV anime [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/170696565)

Shiotani grew up admiring Ghibli films and Ghost in the Shell, so he decided to enroll in an animation school in order to be able to participate in the creating process of anime. After graduating he joined [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) becoming one of their most promising young animators. 

After some years spent climbing to the position of animation director on series such as [Windy Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/1524/Windy-Tales/), he left his first creative mark on the industry by directing, storyboarding and supervising [Blood+](https://anilist.co/anime/150/)'s kaleidoscopic 3rd Opening. 

He had his directorial debut with [Tokyo Marble Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/3088/), OVA produced as a collaboration between Production I.G. and BMG Japan in commemoration of both companies' 20th anniversaries. The OVA was awarded the Grand Prize in the Feature Film Category of the 12th Seoul International Cartoon & Animation Festival in 2008.

Shiotani is most famous for being the director of the [Psycho-Pass](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/) series. Initially planned with a post-apocalyptic setting, the concept changed after the Great East Japan Earthquake and evolved into its final form. The series is inspired by detective crime stories and sci-fi (Minority Report, Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell, Patlabor) with the precise intent of exploring societal problems.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).

[Homepage](egoist-inori.jp) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCchlf66z1NueAv8xY117Lmw) | [Twitter | X](twitter.com/EGOIST_2039) | [Facebook](facebook.com/egoist2039) | [Instagram](instagram.com/egoist_2039)

EGOIST was a fictional band that was created for the anime Guilty Crown.
In August 2023, it was announced that EGOIST would disband after two final concerts.

__Members:__
• Vocals: Inori Yuzuriha ([Former known as chelly - new Stage Name: Reche](https://anilist.co/staff/147835/Chelly))
• Composer/Lyricist/Producer: [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo) ([supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell))

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Came to prominence as an assistant director on numerous films in the '80s and '90s.

Ling Tosite Sigure is an indie rock trio formed in 2002 in Saitama, Japan. The band's style resembles post-hardcore and progressive rock, often incorporating rapid changes of tempo and mood based around complex guitar melodies and technical drumming. They utilize both male and female vocals ranging from soft singing to loud wails and screams.

Members: 
__[TK](https://anilist.co/staff/120249/Tooru-Kitajima)__   (Tooru Kitajima 北嶋徹) – guitar, vocals 
345  (Miyoko Nakamura 中村美代子) – bass, vocals 
Pierre  (Masatoshi Nakano ピエール中野) – drums

node.description: Nothing's Carved in Stone is a Japanese rock group known as the Japan's leading proficient rock band which has overwhelming performance skills. The band started off with the group's guitarist, Shinichi Ubukata（ex ELLEGARDEN） asking to do sessions with Hidekazu Hinata, a bassist of the band STRAIGHTENER after ELLEGARDEN decided to go into hiatus in September 2008. Takanori Ohkita, a drummer for the band FULLARMAR joined the band through the introduction by Hidekazu and they started sessions in absence of vocalist. Shinichi Ubukata got interested in Taku Muramatsu of the band->,the band from ABSTRACTMASH through myspace and went to see his live performance with Takanori Ohkita. Then, they were mesmerized by Taku’s performance. Their debut album “PARALLEL LIVES” was released in 2009.   [Vocal, Guitar] Taku Muramatsu (村松 拓) [Guitar] Shinichi Ubukata (生形 真一) [Bass] Hidekazu Hinata (日向 秀和) [Drums] Takanori Ohkita (大喜多 崇規)  (source: official site)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/竹内敦志)

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Takeuchi is a renown mechanical designer and anime director, having worked on such high profile projects as [The Sky Crawlers](https://anilist.co/anime/3089/) and [Ghost in the Shell](Ghost in the Shell).

He also took part in the production of Star Wars: The Clone Wars.

node.description: Achille-Claude Debussy was a French composer. He was one of the most prominent figures associated with Impressionist music, though he himself intensely disliked the term when applied to his compositions. A crucial figure in the transition to the modern era in Western music, he remains one of the most famous and influential of all composers.   (Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/70045461) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kmotohiro/) | [Website](https://www.motohiro.com/)

More known for his work as a director in the live action industry. Famous for Bayside Shakedown and its theatrical films. The second film in the series has grossed over ¥17.35 billion at the box office, making it the highest-grossing live-action Japanese film on domestic screens.

Since 2013, he has also been a part of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s planning department.
